title.narrative: Increasing marginalised household participation in climate resilient livelihoods

description.narrative:
This project will promote prosperity through inclusive and sustainable agroecology practices and alternative livelihoods which contribute to the local economy. The project has a particular focus on the inclusion of people living with disabilities, women and indigenous groups who are some of the most marginalised groups in Bangladesh society. It will be implemented in two Unions of 1 Upazila (sub-district) in Patuakhali district which is in Bangladesh's extremely climate vulnerable southern coastal belt and aim to reach 2,500 households. The overall project will be implemented jointly by Caritas Bangladesh and ADD who will provide technical expertise in disability inclusion to Caritas Bangladesh.
This project is in line with CAFOD's Bangladesh Country Strategy, and aims to follow an 'integral ecology' approach which aims to develop decent and dignified livelihoods for the poorest and those often excluded from society, and promote agricultural practices which have a positive impact on the environment. Activities including piloting organic compost marketing for women, distribution of climate resilient seeds, trialling new crops and provide vocational training such as small mechanics, electrical repair, mobile phone repair to marginalised groups, particularly women and people living with disability. Learning and trialling new approaches will be a key part of this project.
ADD as a technical partner, will use their detailed experience in supporting the rights of people with disabilities and supporting people develop livelihood options to support Caritas Bangladesh to consider these groups in their work and adapt activities where appropriate.
